text: today's recipe for brown sugar glaze to
brussel sprouts
makes enough to serve a crowd because we
developed it for Thanksgiving so I'm
using three pounds of Brussels sprouts
but it's just as good for a weeknight
meal so if you want to serve a smaller
portion of people a smaller group of
people you can reduce the recipe by I
would say even two-thirds cut it down to
about a pound I've just cut the bottom
off the Brussels sprouts and then I just
cut an X into the bottom and that'll
help them cook more evenly especially
the large ones that ready and I've
cooked five ounces of bacon it's about
five pieces you can see it's cooked down
quite a bit and remove that from my pan
and left about one tablespoon of the
bacon fat in the pan add a tablespoon of
olive oil and then so I'm going to turn
this down for one sec because I want to
slice up five cloves of garlic thinly
slice them if you don't like the sliced
garlic in the final product you can take
these garlic cloves and just crush them
and then you can remove them at the end
and then nobody will have little slices
of garlic I like it I think it tastes
delicious and caramelized but I don't
know everybody's family is different and
some people don't love it you can do
that if you would like now I'm gonna
turn it back up add the garlic you can
make this vegetarian by leaving out the
bacon I'm using turkey broth to cook my
Brussels sprouts but you can definitely
use you know water or vegetable broth if
they want to and then you have
vegetarians also add one tablespoon of
fresh thyme if you can't get that timer
you don't want to for whatever reason or
you have very aggressive in there you
can use dried thyme just use about a
third of the amount so use about a
teaspoon of dry thyme then add five
tablespoons of unsalted butter you add
this once the thyme and the garlic are
fragrant and the Brussels sprouts that's
three pounds of dark brown or light
brown sugar whatever you have don't go
out and buy a new kind of sugar just for
this and then 1/2 a cup of Turkey blocks
like I said if you want this to be
vegetarian use vegetable broth season
with two teaspoons of kosher salt and a
quarter teaspoon of black pepper and
then you want to cook these until
they're nice and tender you want to do
that covered you give this just a little
bit of a stir and then these are braised
instead of boiled I often boil them
where I roast them these are braised so
there's not a ton of liquid in here so
what you're gonna want to do is cover it
up and then cook it at a simmer until
they're tender but you'll want to
uncover it and stir it every once in a
while and that'll take about 18 to 20
minutes when the Brussels sprouts are
just tender you want to uncover them and
then you can turn the heat up at this
point and you want to cook it until most
of the liquid has cooked out stirring
until they're glazed now most of the
liquid has cooked out already
depending on how aggressively you've
been boiling these that could happen but
it can also take up to about nine
minutes for the liquid to cook down into
a glaze but I'm seeing that it's not the
case here which is nice because now I
get to eat them so turn it off and then
I'm gonna sprinkle the bacon on top so I
think it's pretty that way but you can
also just stir it in
I suggest if you're serving this for a
big meal like Thanksgiving or Christmas
put a couple of goals out if you're
serving like family-style on your table
that way people don't have to be passing
things down a long table everybody has
some on their side
serving tip I usually give serving tips
because I feel like I've said this
before but when I'm eating at home with
just my family I do everything I can not
to transfer things into serving dishes
because I don't want to watch any more
dishes sprinkle with some bacon and well
obviously get the taste these are shiny
and fragrant and delightful and tender
and there's sure to be a hit at your
next family event give it a try if you
like recipes like this and you want more
make sure to click like and subscribe
because we have plenty more where this
came from
you
